Hi,

I'm looking for a way to limit in time the WarcWriterProcessor : i wan=
t to create a new Warc file each 5 minutes instead of waiting the end of th=
e crawl or the size limit of the Warc file.

I developed a TimeWARCWriterPr=
ocessor which extends the WARCWriterProcessor in order to add a "maxtime" a=
ttribute which represents the time to wait before creating a new file. The =
"write" function is overrided to check the elapsed time since the creation =
of the current Warc file and to return a "ProcessResult.FINISH" if the time=
 limit is reached. 

This new "write" function is called during the warc pr=
ocess but only once : when the warc file is created. I don't understand how=
 work the write process and when the system check the size (in my case the =
elapsed time) of the current warc writter.

Thanks

Romain
